title: Sri Lanka not ready for connectivity with India by land
byline: Sri Lanka has declined to consider a land connectivity project with India at this hour despite Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi making some remarks about the need for it during bilateral talks, Daily Mirror learns.

title: 'Better Off Playing Rugby'
byline: That blunt advice comes from a former national football star, voicing the deep frustration felt across the football community in Sri Lanka.

title: Vatican to declare Easter Sunday bomb victims as ’Heroes of Faith’ on April 21
byline: The Vatican is to declare those who died in bomb attacks in churches on Easter Sunday six years ago as ’Heroes of Faith’ on Monday April 21, 2025.

title: Daily progress reviews will be held during Sacred Tooth Relic exposition
byline: A progress review of the ’Sri Dalada Dekma’ will be held every morning during the exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic, which is set to begin today at the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy, Kandy District Secretary Indika Udawatte said.

title: Shooting incident reported near school in Ahungalla
byline: A shooting incident was reported in front of a school in Ahungalla, where two unidentified individuals carried out the attack and fled in a three-wheeler, according to police.

title: No special queues for VIPs during sacred tooth relic exposition: DIG
byline: There will be no special passes or separate queues issued for VIPs or VVIPs during the upcoming exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic, set to begin today 18) at the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy, according to Deputy Inspector General of Police for the Kandy and Matale Districts, Sudath Masinghe.

title: US senator meets man mistakenly deported to El Salvador
byline: A US senator has met with a man who Trump administration officials have acknowledged was deported in error from Maryland to a mega-prison in El Salvador.

title: Wild elephant killed by night mail train in Siyambalangamuwa
byline: A wild elephant died in the Siyambalangamuwa area after being knocked down by the night mail train traveling from Colombo Fort to Trincomalee early this morning, officials of the Meegalewa Wildlife Sanctuary said.

title: 50 rounds of ammunition found in Athurugiriya police raid
byline: Police have recovered 50 rounds of live ammunition used for T56 firearms, along with sharp weapons, based on a tip off received by the Athurugiriya police.

title: Foreign diplomats head to Kandy by train for ’Siri Dalada Vandanawa’ inauguration ceremony
byline: Foreign diplomats representing several countries travelled to Kandy this morning in a special observation saloon of a train that departed from the Colombo Fort Railway Station at around 7:00 a.m., the President’s Media Division (PMD) reported.

title: Govt denies issuing VIP invites for Sacred Tooth Relic exposition
byline: The Government Information Department clarified that reports claiming that VIP invitations were issued by the government for special guests to attend the exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic (Sri Dalada Dekma) at the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy are false.

title: Heavy showers, thunderstorms expected in several provinces
byline: Showers of above 50 mm  will occur at several places in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, Southern, Eastern, North-Central and Uva Provinces during the afternoon or night, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Youth missing from Galaboda waterfall
byline: A 20-year-old youth has been reported missing after drowing near the Galaboda waterfall in Nawalapitiya yeasterday.

title: Over 1500 complaints related to LG polls; nine incidents of violence
byline: A total of 94 fresh complaints related to the upcoming Local Government elections were received, pushing the total number to over 1500.

title: Special allowances for police on duty during Sacred Tooth Relic exposition
byline: Following the instructions of the Acting IGP, a special transport allowance and a combined allowance will be provided to police personnel assigned to ensure the safety of local and foreign devotees attending the exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic (Sri Dalada Dekma) at the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy, the police said.

title: Govt denies issuing VIP invitations for Sacred Tooth Relic exposition
byline: The Government Information Department clarified that reports claiming that VIP invitations were issued by the government for special guests to attend the exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic (Sri Dalada Dekma) at the Sri Dalada Maligawa in Kandy are false.

title: Heavy crowds throng Kandy for Dalada exposition
byline: A heavy influx of devotees was experienced by this afternoon in Kandy when the exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic got underway. Most of them had joined the three queues three days ahead of the event.

title: Public Security Minister denies meeting Nissanka Senadhipathi
byline: Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala denied media reports that he had met Nissanka Senadhipathi at his Ministry.

title: Ravi K’s Private Members’ Bill to repeal Online Safety Act gazetted
byline: The Private Members’ Bill presented to Parliament by MP Ravi karunanayake to repeal the Online Safety Act No. 9 of 2024 has been gazetted.

title: Govt. has become a pawn of the thermal power mafia: Sajith
byline: The government which has become a pawn of thermal energy mafia is all out to destroy the renewable energy sector, Opposition and Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Leader Sajith Premadasa charged yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka lock horns with Malaysia in Asia Rugby Top 4 Qualifier
byline: In what promises to be a gripping and high-stakes XV-a-side rugby contest, Sri Lanka will face off against Malaysia tomorrow in the Asia Rugby Top 4 qualification encounter at the Racecourse Ground in Colombo.
